channel.title: How would my computer do hosting a server of 30+?
channel.description:
Heres a pic of my system properties:
I have 257 Gigs free of 270, just if you were wondering.
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/27zm8vs.jpg[/img]
I will be getting more RAM if it can't hold more than 30 smoothly.. Just tell me what you think?
EDIT: I got a question.. Does it help if I switch to the windows 98/95 theme? Because in this one thread I read that it does, but I want to get that confirmed.
Here are my speeds..
[URL=http://www.speedtest.net][IMG]http://www.speedtest.net/result/484866688.png[/img][/URL]
NOTE: I had about 4 internet windows open at the time of the test.

item.title: How would my computer do hosting a server of 30+?
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

That’ll do fine, but try sorting out the efficiency of the actual server source before considering your system specs. I can host between 100-200 mixed active and inactive players on an old dedicated server running linux with a single core 2Ghz processor and 1Gb of RAM.

Read full topic
item.source: How would my computer do hosting a server of 30+?

item.title: How would my computer do hosting a server of 30+?
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:6, topic:281151”][quote author=Newty link=topic=371271.msg2805270#msg2805270 date=1243692429]
That would hold 30 easily, however, if you have a stable base you could hold in excess of 200 or 300.

However, this belongs in General Questions
[/quote]
don’t be so sure, you never asked about an internet connection he might be running a 512k dial up setup for all you know, so the question remains what internet speed have you got, if you don’t know use speedtest.net[/quote]

K, just uploaded a pic.

Read full topic
item.source: How would my computer do hosting a server of 30+?

item.title: How would my computer do hosting a server of 30+?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Thats a half decent computer. A pretty high clock rate for an Intel Core 2.
Next time if you want share your computer stats use CPU-Z. Do A txt dump delete the pointless stats and post it.

-------------------------
  CPU-Z version 1.50
-------------------------

Processors Map
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Number of processors	1
Number of threads	1

Processor 0
    -- Core 0
        -- Thread 0


Processors Information
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Processor 1 (ID = 0)
Number of cores		1 (max 1)
Number of threads	1 (max 1)
Name			Intel Pentium 4 519K
Codename		Prescott
Specification		Intel(R) Pentium(R) 4 CPU 3.06GHz
Package			Socket 775 LGA (platform ID = 4h)
CPUID			F.4.1
Extended CPUID		F.4
Core Stepping		E0
Technology		90 nm
Core Speed		3066.6 MHz (23.0 x 133.3 MHz)
Rated Bus speed		533.3 MHz
Stock frequency		3066 MHz
Instructions sets	MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, EM64T
L1 Data cache		16 KBytes, 8-way set associative, 64-byte line size
Trace cache		12 Kuops, 8-way set associative
L2 cache		1024 KBytes, 8-way set associative, 64-byte line size
FID/VID Control		no
Features		XD





Chipset
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Northbridge		Intel i915P/i915G rev. B1
Southbridge		Intel 82801FB (ICH6) rev. 03
Memory Type		DDR
Memory Size		1024 MBytes
Channels		Dual
Memory Frequency	133.3 MHz (1:1)
CAS#			3.0
RAS# to CAS#		3
RAS# Precharge		3
Cycle Time (tRAS)	8



DIMM #1

General
Memory type		DDR
Manufacturer (ID)	Samsung (CE00000000000000)
Size			512 MBytes
Max bandwidth		PC3200 (200 MHz)
Part number		M3 68L3223FTN-CCC 
Serial number		F106AD6D
Manufacturing date	Week 64/Year 05

Attributes
Number of banks		1
Data width		64 bits
Correction		None
Registered		no
Buffered		no
Nominal Voltage		2.50 Volts
EPP			no
XMP			no

Timings table
Frequency (MHz)		166	200	
CAS#			2.5	3.0	
RAS# to CAS# delay	3	3	
RAS# Precharge		3	3	
TRAS			7	8	


DIMM #2

General
Memory type		DDR
Manufacturer (ID)	Samsung (CE00000000000000)
Size			512 MBytes
Max bandwidth		PC3200 (200 MHz)
Part number		M3 68L3223FTN-CCC 
Serial number		F106AD65
Manufacturing date	Week 64/Year 05

Attributes
Number of banks		1
Data width		64 bits
Correction		None
Registered		no
Buffered		no
Nominal Voltage		2.50 Volts
EPP			no
XMP			no

Timings table
Frequency (MHz)		166	200	
CAS#			2.5	3.0	
RAS# to CAS# delay	3	3	
RAS# Precharge		3	3	
TRAS			7	8

For some reason they brand my processor as 3.06GHz when actualty its 3.07GHz when rounded.
inb4timeforupgrade

As for interent speed, Upload speed is the most important when running a sever.

edit: I have just seen your internet speed and it does not look great but you still should hold a lot of people with a decent source.

Read full topic

However, this belongs in General Questions ;)[/quote]
don’t be so sure, you never asked about an internet connection he might be running a 512k dial up setup for all you know, so the question remains what internet speed have you got, if you don’t know use speedtest.net
